Reviews.Title: “Real nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Bigjoe12
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay the Front desk lady was small but she was sososo nice told us all bout the hotel will be back hope she's still there

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Coopercoy
Reviews.Content: Most comfortable bed I've ever slept on and location was ideal in the French Quarter. Booked a deluxe king room. Was good size and very clean but we were placed far at the end of a hallway near the staff office and were awoken on two mornings at 7AM by hammering/renovation work right outside our door. Was amazed that they would work that early in the morning when people are obviously sleeping. Other than that, service was exceptional. Enjoyed the free breakfast of croissants, eggs, grits, bacon, juice, toast, and yogurts. Don't forget to stop in to Patrick's Bar Vin Wine Bar and speak with Angela, the bartender. She was so helpful in giving us great New Orleans recommendations!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler612_10
Reviews.Content: We have nothing negative to say about this hotel and our experience there... Hotel Mazarin was stunning. The interior courtyard is breathtaking. Breakfast was very filling (eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, assorted pastries & breads, fruit, yogurt, and juice/coffee). The location is ideal, just a mere 40 feet from Bourbon Street and all the action, but quiet enough not to hear any of it at night! Easy enough to explore, head back and take a quick siesta, and then back out for more fun! The bed was incredibly comfortable and plush, the bathroom marble gorgeous. The one thing I wish we had known was that at their 'sister property' there is a pool for customers to use, so make sure to pack that suit! Hotel Mazarin has a promising future ahead of them in the French Quarter! We will definitely be back and staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Betty19
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for French Quarter Fest and was pleased with our room, except wished we had a little more storage space for clothing, other than that we really liked our stay. Breakfast was nice more than simply bread and coffee, eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, tea and coffee, the staff at breakfast were great. Wish the price was a little less, but during a festival it was just about the same as other hotels in the quarter of the same quality.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: out4goodtimes
Reviews.Content: The Mazarin is a jewel. The beds extremely comfortable, the rooms and entire establishment very clean, breakfast above expectations and friendly helpful staff. The location was perfect for us as all attractions were within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family. The courtyard is a relaxing spot to enjoy breakfast or a glass of wine from the bar. I would have given this hotel an excellent rating but the housekeeping staff had a habit of forgetting to provide, soap or towels or glasses. I expressed some concern on this matter and it seems there were some new staff. Once we let them know what we were lacking, they were very quick to respond.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KP_vs_theworld
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, niceness of room, free breakfast, free wifi. Cons: Wifi didn't work, weddings going on into the night makes it hard to sleep, staff is friendly but not very helpful. Overall: nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ross R
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mazarin is located 50 feet from Bourbon St! The room was significantly smaller than it appeared in the pictures on the website. Our room had a balcony over the wine bar courtyard below. This was a great balcony for viewing Bourbon St but pretty small with no chairs on it. The beds at this hotel were ridiculously comfortable and the room was nicely appointed. The only down fall is the noise. We stayed out pretty late, but it seemed like quiet hours in the area are from about 3 a.m. to 6 a.m. So if you are coming to go to sleep early this is not the location for you. If you are coming to party or sleep hard, than I would recommend this hotel. The breakfasts were nice, but the exact same each of the four mornings we were there. A little variation would be nice. Overall a very good experience with polite staff & very efficient cleaning folks.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: touschez
Reviews.Content: This is the old St Louis Hotel that's been completely remodeled. Stayed here 2 years ago...musty, dirty, roaches. Couldn't find a room in the quarter because of French Quarter Fest except for here,( probably because of the name change) and didn't realize it was the old St Louis. would never have stayed here, but I'm soooo happy we did. It's just beautiful now. Sparkling clean, luxurious linens, and towels. Marble floors are so clean and window has shutters, so they will avoid musty carpet and fabric smells. Great idea. We also didn't have a fridge, was told it would be sent up but never came. Large empty area by window should have had a table and chair , had to put things on the floor. Phone was also not plugged in and charged and couldn't call desk by the code on the phone, tried 0 and reached it that way. Room did have a strange smell, reminded me of roach spray! but may have been new furniture smell?? New buffet breakfast is just great. Fresh fruit cup. Scrambled eggs, perfect crispy bacon!, sausage,grits. Lots of other pastries, cereals, fruit yogurt as well as plain. Read here on line that could order eggs cooked to order, which I would have loved but was never told that, and there was no sign saying that. Can eat either in breakfast room in AC, or out in lush courtyard. Huge asset to the hotel. Hotel bar is also just beautiful and has a lounge area, an outside patio area and also the courtyard area to have a drink in. We did not have a wedding reception while we were there, but would not appreciate loud music till 11. Maybe management can stop that at 10, 10:30. After all it is the French Quarter, they can go party out there all night! But we are always prepared and use earplugs. We will definitely go back. I've stayed in many places in the quarter and you can't beat this for location, ambiance, comfort, and now a great breakfast. Hotel just needs to get outfitted with all of it's furniture, weatherstripping, etc. and it will be a fantastic place to enjoy New Orleans from.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Della113
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and both times have exceeded my expectations. The hotel is modern in yet still has the old world charm that I love so much in New Orleans. The staff is very warm and friendly and goes out of their way to help with any issues you may be having. They also are very good with giving recommendations for dining. Every room opes to courtyard, which at any other hotel you would pay a premium rate for. I can't say enough good about the Hotel Mazarin. It is a charming little jewel and I can't wait for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Orleans welcome”
Reviews.Author: saetor
Reviews.Content: A change of name caused some concern but the refurbishment of The St. Louis Hotel and the renaming to The Mazarin Hotel, Rue Bienville was a wonderful experience for us. Our greeting at the hotel was warm and friendly and overall we enjoyed our three night stay. However the long haul to the "annex" with suitcases, in the rain was not for the faint hearted, so if you're booking and not wishing to haul lugage please ask for a room in the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovation job, wonderful service, wedding music too loud!”
Reviews.Author: Price1963
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, large well appointed beautiful room (delux king),great location, service was outstanding. Our room was on the top (5th floor), all room doors open into the courtyard, while it was secure and confortable, there were weddings during the day on Saturday and Sunday evening, the music was so loud in the courtyard that the sound in the room was unbearable! We called the front desk to complain and were told by Alyesse "it's a wedding". Yeah, I saw the wedding party and understood fully it was a WEDDING. I was asking to have the music turned down so that we could hear ourselves think...no chance! Unfortunately there were two wedding this weekend, so the second time, we checked out and went home. My advice is to call the hotel and ask if there is a wedding scheduled for the evening (they blast music till 11pm). I'd love to stay here again, but will choose the Monteleon to avoid this problem. It's not quite as nice but you won't have to worry that your ears will still be ringing 2 days later. By the way, there was a 1 1/2" gap under the door and no weather stripping around the opening, maybe the hotel will address these issues and then all will be well.

Reviews.Title: “good, but...”
Reviews.Author: njretiree
Reviews.Content: Can't add too much to the other reviews, but they still have some kinks to work out. Our room didn't get street noise because of it's location but we kept waking up to banging from an interior corridor door literally all night long. I did report this at checkout so hopefully, the hotel has resolved this problem for future guests. Breakfast was good, but exactly the same both mornings, that would have gotten very boring on a longer stay. We thoroughly enjoyed the Bar Vin, and chatting with Patrick, sharing his "dream".

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vlbcf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Mazarin. We stayed on the 5th floor and although we did not have a balcony, the room was perfect! ( Only rooms with balconys are on the 3rd floor). The cool black marble floors were a welcome relief for tired feet at the end of the day. The shower was huge, the bed was very comfortable and I loved the shutters on the windows. Our room did not have the promised refrigerator but one was delivered the next day after we requested one. The breakfast is far from continental, it is a FULL breakfast with the added bonus of freshly cut fruit bowls every morning. The croissants are amazing! The courtyard is beautiful and well maintained. Our only negative experience was with check-in. We arrived in the morning and was able to store our luggage but did not recieve the phone call that the clerk assured us would come when our room was ready. We had to wait in line for quite awhile with everyone else after coming back at 400 to check on our room status. Should we ever return to NOLA, we will definitely stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: TRose01
Reviews.Content: Great location...close to the trolley, you're right in the FQ, and walking distance to the Marginy area. Our room was clean (definite plus) and nicely decorated. Nice size bathroom too. We were able to check in early around 10:30 am (they didn't make us wait, so that is a plus in my book) and when we asked for a "quiet" room away from the atrium/streets, our request was granted with no issues (again, another plus.) The morning breakfast was way better than expected and there was something for everyone...scrambled eggs, croissants, bagels, cereal, juices, fruit, plus many more options. The doormen and front desk were very plesant and the wait staff had great attitudes. Comfy beads/pillows. All around an excellent stay and wouldn't hesitate to return. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “A french style boudoir hotel just where you want to be in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mitochondrial
Reviews.Content: We booked this blind through an agency as part of a wider tour. The hotel has just been revamped having previously been called the St Louis Hotel. Quality, Quality, good breakfast, beautiful rooms. Lovley hotel bar. Worth a booking.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn2aj
Reviews.Content: Since this was our first trip to New Orleans really didn't know what to expect. We went by what was advertized. Courtyard view, desk in room, separate vanity. No desk,no vanity just a pedistal sink and our view was of a roof. The room was clean and the bed and bedding was amazing. I guess I should have asked more questions. Had to ask three times for a waste paper basket. Overall everyone was very pleasant. The hotel is still a work in progress, a lot of construction still going on.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Maryam S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I was concerned that the noise would make it hard to sleep (since we had a courtyard view room), but it really wasn't much of an issue. Special thanks to Theodore and Rene for their wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new French Quarter accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: blk47rs
Reviews.Content: The only major drawback to this hotel is that there is so much to do in in New Orleans but the beds at the Mazarine are so comfortable you never want to get out. I'm sure I lingered beneath the covers at least an hour longer than I had planned each morning. Other strengths include the staff, who were all extremely helpful, genuine and friendly, and the room decor, which was tasteful and lovely. Drawbacks were fairly minor. Rooms could have used a safe, a second wastebasket and more counter space in the bathroom. I look forward to staying at the Mazarine again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: PT_N_ST
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mazarin great location right on Bienville Street, between Bourbon Street & one block fom Royal Street. The hotel has been recently renovated. A few small items still need to be added. Wall safe and small room refrigerator still need to be put in place. But that did not affect us. Front desk has a safe if you need to have anything stored for safekeeping. Very, very clean, not a speck of dust. The bed,â€œTO DIE FORâ€�. Slept like a rock! Saturday night the loudest, then again you are in New Orleans in the French Quarter! No need to use a car; walking distance to all the top and inexpensive restaurants, shops, and the French Market. We ate in GW Fins, & The Bombay Club. Two fine restaurants if you are looking to get away from the usual tourist places. Both are right near the Hotel Mazarin. Service in the hotel fabulous, staff is there when you need them. All very friendly, donâ€™t be afraid to ask them to point out their favorite places that they like, and points of interest. Renee is a great person to ask for information, he is always willing to help. A lovely wine bar is attached to the hotel, 70 different wines by the glass, impressive. Stayed four days March 10-14, wished we could have stayed four more! The weather was fine for us, cool not hot. Room has great climate control system very quiet. Would definitely recommend and stay here again. Nice breakfast, starts at 7 am. Loved everything!!! See yah down in the big EZ.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and historic boutique hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: skeetidot
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Excellent location in the heart of the French Quarter - Recently renovated - Historic and trendy boutique hotel - Free breakfast - Beautiful courtyard Cons: - Room keys may need to be reset by the front desk multiple times. Our room keys failed twice in less than 24 hours. - Room cleanliness was less than expected. This historic hotel was recently renovated. It has a combination of trendy decor with southern charm. The location and design are excellent! The only issues encountered with the hotel were

Reviews.Title: “Sister's trip to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Paris_Expats
Reviews.Content: My sister took a trip to New Orleans to celebrate her 50th birthday and had a great time! Hotel Mazarin was perfect for us. We stayed 4 nights and this hotel has recently been refurbished, everthing is new and clean, yet this hotel has still maintained it's charm. The comfortable beds, plush towels and robes, the AMAZING breakfast (especially the fresh/warm croissants and pain au chocolates which are to die for!). The staff is very friendly and then you have the location, convenient to all of the sites of New Orleans (or within walking distance to the trolley cars to get you there). We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kim365
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Sunday March 18 and left on Tuesday March 20, 2012. What a beautiful place, this was the last leg on a bike trip that started in Orlando, let me tell you what a pleasure it was to arrive outside the Mazarin! Right away you are struck by the little details of this renovated gem. Gas lamps, plants, and great staff to welcome you! Booked our room through Book-it and saved that way, stayed in room 402, just beside the main elevator, king superior which faced Beinville. The window did not open but just as well as street noise can be a problem. The room was more than spacious with nice touches, a chandalier, tri-light floor lamps, duvet on the bed, luxurious sheets, marble floors through out, a lovely bath with a great shower. Nice details like having the faucet at the opposite end of the shower head, no cold starts!! The best bath linens I have ever seen at a hotel...an electronic safe, nice size tv, the list goes on... The courtyard was tremendous, treed with a fountain in the middle, the breakfast buffet was substantial, everything from fresh fruit cups, juices, eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, brioche, croissants, chocolate and plain, yogourt, milk, cereal...and the best was the community coffee they served! service was from 7 till 11 am, lots of time for refills or late starts. In the evening the bar was open which had a little patio with a fountain, private and once again stunning, a perfect place to relax and enjoy a cigar! If you had a question, the staff came through for you, I have no complaints, I would strongly recommend the Mazarin, for service and location, this newly renovated gem is going to be on my return list!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and great service”
Reviews.Author: texas07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Mazarin March 15th through the 19th. It was a wonderful stay. The hotel is between Bourbon street and Royal street. Amazing location. Steps from Bourbon but we never heard any music from the bars. We did hear people when they walked down the hallway and we could hear the valet's honk the horns throughout the night. The service at the front desk was outstanding. We had so many questions during our stay and the doormen and front desk staff did everything they could to answer our questions and help us out. The rooms were a bit cramped but they were very attractive. The beds were very comfortable, especially the pillows. The tv's were huge and the view of the courtyard was nice. There wasn't a fridge or safe in our room but that didn't bother us. My complaint about the bathroom was the lack of shelf space at the sink and the missing door on the shower. Even if we aimed the shower head to the side all of the water would splash out on the ground. The breakfast was good when it was full. Sometimes the food went quickly but the staff was always working hard to refill it. The best part of this hotel had to be the location. We didn't have a car for the week and we only needed a taxi to and from the airport, commander's palace and the old new Orleans rum distillery. Other than that we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average”
Reviews.Author: L F
Reviews.Content: I would like to rate this better than average, because it really is a lovely place, and fabulously located. It has the perfect New Orleans "feel", and was very clean and friendly. I love the open-air courtyard, and small lobby. The staff was awesome. We asked for water because it was in the room at arrival, and it was there before we could blink! Our balcony room was very nice and modern with marble floors and wonderful shower. Now the downside - although there is a small shelf above the sink, this is one of those bathrooms with a pedestal sink and no counter, so all of my hair accesories and makeup was in my bag on the floor. There is a perfect space for a corner rack/shelving unit beside the sink which needs to be added. The main reason I cannot rate it higher is the extreme noise level. I take fault since I rented a balcony room, but be prepared to stay out all night because the noise is unrelenting. As soon as I would fall asleep, another group would drive by blowing horns, and belting out rap music. I might as well have been in the car with them. You could actually hear conversations of drunk people. This went on until 4-5am. You just want to say "Quit blowing you #**$$ horn and playing rap music"! I'm all for staying out late and partying, but this was beyond that level of intelligence. This is not the hotel's fault obviously, but be wise when choosing your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: knowhowtotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and New Orleans is great. The hotel is recently renovated and the rooms were fantastic with an excellent bed. The free breakfast was fantastic. Free wi fi. The best location in NO, only a half block from Bourbon st yet not the noise of the party goers. The staff were great also. About a $30 cab ride ...with tip to airport. We had a room on the second floor facing the courtyard and any noise from that area came into the room. This area is used for breakfast and also for functions and the noise from staff setting up tables is annoying. From our room we heard the guest rolling their luggage along the tiled walkway in front of our room. This hotel would rate excellent if they put some work into soundproofing the rooms more. Overall a great stay....the position .....great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: angie_r30
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time earlier this week here. Got our reservation through Bookit and saved a lot of money. Beautiful courtyard where they serve a buffet breakfast every morning, enough food to keep you going til lunch. Beds are amazing and I really wanted to take a pillow home! Close enough to walk to everything, but not so close as to be bothered by crowds. I had no problem with noise. Staff makes all the difference. They are really very friendly and enjoyed telling us some of the history. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The New Jewel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: bohemian81
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth hotel to visit in the French Quarter in nine years, and we believe we've finally found the place we'll happily return to. First of all, you absolutely cannot beat the location: half a block from Bourbon and very centrally located to everything in the Quarter. Secondly, for its proximity so close to the action, the room was surprisingly quiet. Our Superior King room opened onto a center courtyard and had no street-facing windows. Occasionally I could hear the water splashing in the courtyard fountain the first two nights, but the second two nights they didn't run the fountain. The beds were VERY comfortable. We slept longer there than we have for months at home. The front desk was over-the-top helpful trying to navigate us to the hotel during a crazy Saturday night arrival: crowds from the SEC basketball playoffs and from the St. Joseph's Day parade prevented us from getting the car to the hotel. The adjacent Bar Vin was very nice, and Angela at the bar paid us a very nice turn. The rooms are beautifully appointed, and I loved the black marble floor throughout. It's much better than stepping out onto carpet because you always know when the marble is clean. With hotel carpets I sometimes have my doubts. The complimentary breakfast from 7:00-11:00 every morning was a real money-saver. I'm VERY happy we booked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: christianabrewster
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay was over a 3 nights. For the price $877 it was okay the location Bourbin street was great. I had a room in the back which helped with the noise. But if you are a light sleeper this might not be the hotel for you. When I arrived there was not a refridge in the room. I called the front desk and the receptionist said that the shipment had been delayed and offered to lock my medication up in the kitchen. After I told her that was unacceptable she offered to move a refridge to my room. That was the only incident duringbmynstay. The breakfast was great and offered to 11am which was great after staying up late. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Non Accomadating Staff/Lack of Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Lmzerin
Reviews.Content: Paying $460 for a Saturday night rate. Considering the location that is not too bad. The thing that gets me is the room does not come with a microwave and fridge in the room. Even the 2 star Holiday Inn has those. The only thing 4 star worthy of our room was the very comfortable bed and the fancy floors and shower. It was difficult to sleep as there was a wedding with a live band in the courtyard that went until midnight and after that the noise spillover from Bourbon St and the rude guests yelling in the courtyard. By the time I got to sleep the breakfast service started in the courtyard and you could hear everybody chatting and clinking their silverware. We used their valet service and it took them almost 45 minutes to get our car out of the parking garage across the street because the misplaced the tag on their end. We should have stayed in the Business District and took a cab to Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mazarin has almost completed renovations and it's as great as a European five star location. Only 1/2 black off Burbon street but offering a quiet respite. The room included a hot breakfast with many offerings. The breakfast buffet was offered in an elegant restaurant with the optional seating in the interior courtyard of the hotel...beautiful! This a great location for sightseeing the entire French Quarter. Park your car ($30+ a day) and walk the French Quarter and Riverwalk. Many great restaurants in the immediate area. This is the place to stay in the French Quarter!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.....”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyJane32
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Mazarin located 1/2 block off Bourbon St. Hotel is still finalizing their renovations but 90% was complete. Great employees, Renee, (doorman) greated me every morning and was very helpful in giving good recommendations of where to sightsee and eat. Our room was totally renovated, marble floors, new furniture, new bathroom. The room was not big but who stays in the room except to sleep. One of the most comfortable beds I every slept in while vacationing. Nice Courtyard for receptions/weddings and a very nice Bar area called Bar Vin, excellent wine! Hotel is located close to everything, shopping, the best restaurants and of course Bourbon St....Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great location...just bring ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: jerseyjoew
Reviews.Content: Remodeled hotel with everything looking new. Your located between Royal and Bourbon streets which is a perfect location.Everything is in walking distance( 3 blocks from trolleys).$6 cab ride to Frenchman street.Free breakfast and free WiFi, cant beat that.Our room was 3rd floor and included a small refrigerator.Great shower ,comfortable beds.Only downside is you can hear Bourbon street and talking from the Hotel courtyard.So bring ear plugs and you cant go wrong with this hotel.Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Ashton B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away in the French Quarter, but amazingly outside the from door is everything. Will stay here every time in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough!!!”
Reviews.Author: KristaSheehan
Reviews.Content: We went to NOLA for my birthday this passed weekend and stayed at the Hotel Mazarin. It was wonderful! I can honestly say that I can't think of one bad thing. We got there at 4PM on a Friday night and no line to check in. Quick and painless the way I like it. Get up to our room....WOW! The only other hotel I have stayed in in NOLA was The Omni on St. Louis Avenue and this hotel defiently gave it a run for its money considering the price was half of the Omni! The room was perfect, the beds were comfy, linens soft, the courtyard was unbelievable...it was my husbands first time there and I really wanted him to experience NOLA. I wanted him to experience the history, architecture and culture and I really believe that starts with a hotel like the Mazarin. I was pleasantly surprised when I got to my room and there was indeed a small refridgerator. I was under the impression from a previous reviewer that there was no coolers allowed as well as no refridgerators in the room, so I am assuming the hotel saw the review and fixed that problem very quickly. Another good sign of good management! The breakfast was unbeatable, the only thing they were missing was a waffle maker. Eggs, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, juice, coffee etc., also the water in the rooms......FREE!! This was huge considering how badly I wanted water after being out on Bourbon Street all night! Thats another good point was that it was the closest I have ever gotten to stay to Bourbon Street, it was literally right around the corner from the hotel, amazing location! The bathroom does not have a bathtub and I love to take baths, but it was totally OK considering all of the other good aspects of this hotel. I can not reccommend this hotel enough, I would stay there over and over again and would strongly encourage you to try them as well!

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for Prime Time”
Reviews.Author: bgs1
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly enough, but neither experienced or effective. Clueless would be a fairer description. The rooms are recently remodeled, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms modernized. But the level of service is low. The first two days we returned at 3 in the afternoon to find our room uncleaned. Upon complaining to desk we were assured that the rooms would be serviced immediately, but an hour later no one had appeared. For a remodeled hotel, you would assume that they would have also updated their technology. Not ! This hotel has about the worst Internet connection I have experienced anywhere. At first I thought it was just our room, but the lobby and business center were just as bad. I asked other guests that we met in the restaurant and all had the same complaint. We were getting speeds (according to speed test) of .35mps down and the upload was so slow it would only register .10mps. Overall a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a "LUXURY" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Barintam
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 1PM and was told that my room was not going to be ready until check in time which is 3 PM and that is fine but then my room was not ready until 5 P.M.! We missed the Mardis Gras Parade that had Will Ferrel because we could not get into our room to get ready. The guy at the desk was very sarcastic and condescending throughout our wait for our room and when I asked who his manager was he said he WAS the manager. Then when we checked out I called to tell them bring my car because we were leaving and then packed and went downstairs. My car was parked across the street and it took them over an hour to get it! I was the only person sitting down there waiting on a car so I know they were not that busy. I was also unhappy that I paid $270 per night for a LUXURY hotel that did not even have a mini fridge. Positives were the Comfy bed and nice TV.

Reviews.Title: “This place really has some potential!”
Reviews.Author: Noleman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 25th Anniversary trip back to New Orleans. This was the old St. Louis hotel and it has been remodeled. It is a block off Bourbon Street. The staff was one of the most accommodating and friendly I've ever experienced. The rooms are remarkable, with tile floors, nice beds. Great breakfast in a beautiful courtyard. The only reason I can't give it an excellent rating is they are still doing some construction. I took my sound machine, so I didn't hear them all that much, but the workers were out painting at 7:30am each morning. It appears near completion, so it shouldn't be a problem in the future, but check just in case if that bothers you. Certainly didn't bother us much, and all in all, we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay- Feb 14th”
Reviews.Author: Angel P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 1 night stay at Hotel Mazarin for Valentine's Day. The room was really nice and very up to date with the marble floors, counter top and shower. The bed was extremly comfortable. The courtyard was nice & breakfast was pretty good, grits, eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, yougurt coffee, & juice. The staff was really nice & very helpful. My only compliants are that the room had no frig or microwave & the fees. Upon my arrival I was advised there will be a $50 incindental charge that will be refunded after you check out. When booking I was advised that parking was $32 only to find out being that we have a Avalanche our parking fee was $36 as a oversized parking which also didn't include a 12% parking sales tax in addtion. The room rate had 2 taxes a 6% city tax & a 7% state tax also a $1 a night room occupancy fee but hey it's New Orleans all about making money for them.

Reviews.Title: “No safe and fridge otherwise nice”
Reviews.Author: Tamaria
Reviews.Content: Checked in Feb 11 for my birthday weekend. Rooms are nice with marble floors all over, only shower in our room, bathrobe and slippers for one. We called to get another robe and slipper set and ask about the safe. It seemed the lady was surprised we had no safe but said she would send items up. Happy about this we headed out. We returned around 2 am to find no safe still in room. This would not have been a problem if we had not brought a laptop, iPad, cell phones and pieces of expensive jewelry. Well we phoned downstairs again and were informed none of the rooms had safes, not what we were told earlier. The problem was Expedia stated they had a fridge and the Mazarin hotel site stated they had a safe. Due to medications needing refrigeration and our jewelry we requested a change to another hotel which offered those items. I am not happy we were charged a full night when the advertising by both sites were misrepresented and plan to take this matter further. The staff was very good but in this instance seemed unknowledgeable of what hotel offered. Not happy about additional expense to move and travel to different hotel.d. This hotel is in a great location and the room is good. The view was ok. We could peek over and see the garden area but not street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,everything new,super grand opening special price”
Reviews.Author: beerman
Reviews.Content: Arrived early,valet/doorman took care of taking luggage...really nice guy. We were told room would't be ready til about 3 and they would call us...got call at 2 recived room on 5th floor very nice, luggage was sent up promptly.room had window to street but all you could see was the sonesta accross the way.Bathroom was nice but lacked counter space and the shower with no door did get the bathroom floor very wet.TV was great. Room could use small refrigerator had space for one though.maybe still in the future. I-pod station worked well. Room could also use a safe. Lobby was very small. Staff were exceptionally friendly,and were willing to answer any questions The courtyard was nice but had a tent like plastic tarp covering it,I guess because of final construction. We recieved free breakfast both mornings which was pretty good, basicly buffet but you could order eggs other than scrambled

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mazarin provided an exceptional experience during my stay. Located half a block off Bourbon Street, this hotel serves a the perfect place to accommodate a night out in the Quarter. The staff encompassed the highest level of hospitality and room amenities were immaculate. I especially enjoyed the view of the quarter from my surprisingly spacious room! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shannan_12
Reviews.Content: The hotel mazarin was beautifully decorated, the courtyard is gorgeous. Thinking of having my wedding there! will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “I am impressed!”
Reviews.Author: karen p
Reviews.Content: I recently took a trip ths week to New Orleans and stayed at the brand new hotel and I was very impressed. The room was elegant and luxurious with all the top notch amenities and the bed was very comfortablewith soft linens. It was very clean and the staff was very friendly. I especially loved the Renassiance inspired courtyard that was decorated with beautiful trees and flowers -- it was magical. The hotel was a wonderful history and I loved the wrought iron features and accents of elegance and sophistication. I would highly recommend this new hotel and the best part - it is in the French Quarter~

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mazarin
HotelInfo.Address: 730 Rue Bienville, New Orleans, LA 70130
